parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and leipo; to leave down, i.e. Behind; by implication, to abandon, have remaining.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Of Chaldee origin; date-house; Beth-any, a place in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lodge in the open, lodge, pass the night. Middle voice from aule; to pass the night.
